official-title.#text:
To establish universal access programs to improve high risk pools and reinsurance markets to ensure
			 coverage for individuals with pre-existing conditions, and for other
			 purposes.

text.#text: If the program or pool operated under

quote.#tail:
means a program operated by a State program that provides reinsurance for health insurance
			 coverage offered in the small group market in accordance with the model
			 for such a program established (as of the date of the enactment of this
			 Act).

text.#text: For purposes of this section, a
A qualified State reinsurance program may provide reinsurance—
on a prospective or retrospective basis; and

on a basis that protects health insurance issuers against the annual aggregate spending of their
			 enrollees as well as purchase protection against individual catastrophic
			 costs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , to be a qualified high risk pool under such section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 2745 of the Public
			 Health Service Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:2745

text.#text: A qualified State reinsurance program shall be deemed, for purposes of

A qualifying State high risk pool described in this subsection means a current section 2745
			 qualified high risk pool that meets the following requirements:

The pool must provide at least two coverage options, one of which must be a high deductible health
			 plan coupled with a health savings account.
The pool must be funded with a stable funding source.

The pool must eliminate any waiting lists so that all eligible residents who are seeking coverage
			 through the pool should be allowed to receive coverage through the pool.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, would be eligible for
			 Medicare during the period of such waiting period.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 226(b) of the Social Security Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security Act/s:226/ss:b

text.#text:
The pool must allow for coverage of individuals who, but for the 24-month disability waiting period
			 under

The pool must limit the pool premiums to no more than 150 percent of the average premium for
			 applicable standard risk rates in that State.

The pool must conduct education and outreach initiatives so that residents and brokers understand
			 that the pool is available to eligible residents.
The pool must provide coverage for preventive services and disease management for chronic diseases.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or this
			 section.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2745 of the Public Health Service Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Health Service Act/s:2745

shall keep sufficient records such that a determination of citizenship or nationality
			 only has to be made once for any individual under this paragraph.
